Summary I am a Unix Systems Administrator with 20 years experience, which includes 9 years experience in RedHat Enterprise Linux, and 4 years of CentOS 5.x Linux, and over 10 years in Solaris.  
 
I worked in several large scale enterprise computing environments with over 7000 servers, including Redhat 5.x, Solaris 10, Windows Server 2000/2003/2008. Other tools include Veritas Volume Manager (VxVM), Veritas Cluster Server (VCS), and Windows Cluster Server (cluadmin), VMware, and HP OpsWare. 
 
At Aeris Communications, I increased up-time by over 10x (99.790% to 99.998%) in just over one year, and brought a disaster recovery facility in Las Vegas Nevada to a system and network level ready state. 
 
My current experience has been programming using bash script for general Unix automation. 
 
Louis Fico 
(408)483-4659 
lmeinc@yahoo.com

http://www.lmei.com/ Experience Sr Systems Administrator eBay Inc December 2014  – Present (9 months) San Jose, CA Sr Systems Administrator Xilinx April 2013  –  November 2014  (1 year 8 months) Engineering user support of CAD and XWindows based applications under RedHat Linux. 
 
Wrote bash scripts for log parsing and VNC server connection reporting. 
 
Installed Mentor Graphics, Synopsis, Avanti Quartus, and Cadence software releases. 
 
PXE Linux server and desktop installations along with Puppet post provisioning and LANDesk. 
 
Dell M1000e Blade , HP Proliant Blade, Dell Desktop installations of RedHat Linux 4.x, 5 .x, 6.x, both bare metal and VMware. 
 
Solaris 8/9/10 legacy support. Sr Systems Engineer Yahoo! June 2012  –  March 2013  (10 months) Sunnyvale, CA Daily on-call supporting the data mining highway 100% of the time, Monday-Friday 9+ hour shift. 
 
Bash scripting for Excel processing for summarizing job times of cookie feeds. 
 
RedHat Linux 5.x, FreeBSD 6.4, HP and Dell blade servers, Hadoop, Nagios, automation. Sr. Unix Systems Administrator Intuit Inc 2009  –  2012  (3 years) San Diego and Mountain View CA Post provisioning RedHat 5.5 and Solaris 10 physical and virtual servers, including security hardening (JASC), client software such as VAS (Active Directory support), snmp, routing, DNS name resolution by application & site, ntp, OpsWare client, SMTP, Cacti, Spectrum, and Disk Suite (LVM) mirroring of OS disks. 
 
Worked with in the Storage Group, migrating Veritas Plex Mirrors from one EMC frame to a replacement EMC frame, with final relocation of the new EMC frame from San Diego CA to Quincy WA. This task included working with Veritas Volume Manager (VxVM) and Veritas Cluster Server (VCS) on physical and virtual systems under Solaris 10 (50%), RedHat Linux 4/5 (35%), and Windows 2003 Server (15%). 
 
Server patch project for 7000 servers running Sun Solaris 8/9/10, RedHat Linux 3/4/5, and MS Windows 2000/2003/2008. Tools included Unicenter Desktop and Server Management (DSM), putty, BMC Remedy 7.1.00, Remote Desktop Connection (RDC), Controlit, Solaris Containers/Zones, VMware, Microsoft Active Directory (AD) usage, and HP OpsWare. 
 
A pre documentation methodology was required as part of the updating process, including user contact and approval, patch details, and status, which was provided through BMC Remedy. 
 
Team effort and scheduling was required working as a part of a large team of system engineers. Unix Systems Administrator Aeris Communications 2007  –  2009  (2 years) Sole support of 100+ Sun (T5120s, T2000s, V240s, V210s, etc) and IBM (x360, x345) servers in three facilities, Solaris 8, Solaris 10, and RedHat Linux ES 3.0, ES 4.0. 
 
Brought disaster recovery site in Las Vegas Nevada from an obsolete state to a current working state, including network changes to conform to the primary site, along with all services including nine NIS servers, ten DNS server upgrades to Bind 9, six ntp servers, application software servers, and backup services (ufsdump and Veritas NetBackup). 
 
Solaris 8 to 10 migration of 70+ servers at corporate office and two co-locations (San Jose CA and Las Vegas NV).  
 
Support for 12+ IBM x345 and x360 under RedHat Linux 3.0 ES & 4.0 ES servers.  
 
Several Oracle migrations from Solaris 8 to 10, starting with Oracle 9.2.0.3 Solaris 8, to 9.2.0.7_64 Solaris 8, 9.2.0.7_64 Solaris 10, and Oracle 10G under Solaris 10.  
 
Maintenance and support for SMTP mail services included one Solaris SMTP internal mail server, the building of a dual Solaris 10 SMTP external mail service for a support domain, and integration of the SMTP mail services with an external corporate MS/Exchange mail service. Enabled relaying features, macro activation of masquerading, and enabling the access database access for acceptance and rejection of wanted and unwanted email. 
 
Software installation of DNS Zone (bind 9) on ten DNS servers, NIS across 7 NIS servers, OpenRoad, Purify, Sun Studio 11 & 12, Veritas NetBackup servers and clients, ufsdump backup servers, Apache & TomCat installation, SMTP mail servers, ftp servers using ProFTP and vsftpd, ntp servers and mirrors built for ntp (Network Time Protocol) clients in 3 sites. 
 
Increased production uptime by more than ten fold (99.790% to 99.998%) in just over one year, and increasing uptime as required in Aeris’ SLAs (Service Level Agreements). 
 
Hardening servers on the DMZ including using the SUNWjass package. 
 
Big Brother installation and monitoring in 24x7 NOC site. Unix Systems Administrator Fairchild Semiconductor 2000  –  2007  (7 years) Brought RedHat Linux to Fairchild in 2003, two years before any other group. Installed RedHat KickStart on RedHat and Solaris 10 servers. 
 
Scaled replacement systems. 
 
Combined three NIS domains plus standalone systems into one NIS domain. Provided better scalability, security, reliability, and maintainability. 
 
Simulation software and flexlm licensing servers. 
 
Network services (NIS, DNS, SMTP, backup, printing, etc). Went from 10-15 legacy servers to 70+ servers, including test, pre-production, and production networks. 
 
Veritas and Sun DiskSuite (LVM) volume managers, Veritas Cluster Server, HA techniques. 
 
Sybase and Oracle servers.

Summary - Network and Systems Architect - 
 
I analyze and diagnose troubled networks and redesign them to be efficient, reliable, and scalable. What I bring to systems and network design is the knowledge that each component is part of the system—users, applications, software, developers, and hardware—and every one has to be taken into account. 
 
- Skills And Qualifications - 
 
* 15+ years in networking and systems. 
* Rapidly fire-fight in unfamiliar environments. 
* Support developers to ensure that software, network and system work together. 
* USENIX Level IV systems administrator and charter member of LOPSA. 
* Have in-depth knowledge of PCI DSS requirements for credit card processing environments. 
* Operating Systems: UNIX (FreeBSD, BSDi, BSD/OS, Mac OS X), Linux (Red Hat, CentOS, SUSE, Debian, Ubuntu), Windows XP/2000/2003, and others. 
* Configuration Management: Puppet, Chef, Salt. 
* Network Products: Cisco, Foundry, Extreme, and HP routers and switches; Trango and other wireless gear; Cisco PIX and ASA, WatchGuard, SonicWALL, NetScreen, Fortinet, GNAT Box, SnapGear firewalls; CacheFlow cache engines; Acucomm DSLAMS; Foundry ServerIron, F5 BigIP, and Cisco CSS load balancers, Internap FCP route controller. 
* Network Technologies: BGP, RIP, OSPF, RADIUS, DNS (BIND, djbdns), ATM. 
* Programming/Scripting Languages: Shell (sh, tcsh, bash, ksh), awk/sed, PHP, Perl, Python, Ruby, node.js. 
* Web: Apache, PHP, ColdFusion, JRun, JBOSS, Apache Tomcat, DBRocket DBML, Jetty, Cake, Varnish, nginx, haproxy, stunnel, Akamai NetStorage and AkaDNS. 
* Databases: MySQL, PostgreSQL, Oracle. 
* Storage: SAN (FibreChannel and iSCSI), NFS using EMC, Pillar, Brocade, Dell hardware. 
* Virtualization: VMware Virtual Infrastructure, VMware ESX, VMware Server, Xen hypervisor. 
* Cloud: Amazon AWS - EC2, RDS, SimpleDB, S3, EMR, Cloudfront.

Summary 18 years of experience in IT and communications management, systems administration and software development on a broad range of companies and institutions, including worldwide non-profit organisations, national sports associations, management and IT consulting, nationwide tourism industry, automotive industry, construction industry and others. 
Getting to know such different realities gave me a very flexible and open mindset in all things regarding IT management and the tools to adapt whenever needed.

- Virtualization

Summary I have 26+ years experience with different UNIX platforms, primarily Solaris 8, 9 and 10. I have also worked with Red Hat Enterprise Linux, HP-UX, AIX, SCO and Digital UNIX. I have configured and maintained Solaris 10 zones and I have strong scripting skills in C-shell, Korn and Bourne shells. 
 
I am currently with FairPoint Communications in Manchester NH. 
 
From February 2010 to July 2013, I was contracting at Raytheon IDS HQ in Tewksbury supporting iCenter and iTracker. From mid-August until the end of November, I was contracted to Raytheon at their Missile Defense Center in Woburn administrating Solaris 8, 9, and 10, RHEL, HP-UX and IRIX servers in Closed Room environments. 
 
From the beginning of 2008 to mid-2009, I implemented secure connectivity solutions for JP Morgan Chase and its clients via sFTP (SSH), FTPs (SSL), AS2, and HTTPs.  
 
Prior to that, since mid-2006, I was contracted to a Massachusetts state agency administrating their Solaris 10 servers and supporting Oracle development efforts. 
 
From 1997 to 2006, I managed multiple secure FTP sites for a large world-wide electronics manufacturing firm. 
 
I have had security training with Windows NT, Win 2K and XP through my years with the NH National Guard CERT and hold an Active Secret Security Clearance.  Although I am primarily a UNIX Admin, I am comfortable in a Windows environment. 
 
I was an adjunct instructor teaching UNIX Systems Admin classes for Continuing Education at UMASS/Lowell and have instructed basic UNIX classes for previous companies, as well as for the military.  I have excellent presentation and communication skills. 
 
I am a team player, but also work well independently. 
 
Specialties: Excellent documentation skills, good technical liaison between company and customer base, and between company divisions and groups. I am a shell scripting god. Summary NON STOP INTERNETS 
 
I am a UNIX sysadmin with almost two decades of experience with Internets and startups and dotcoms. I wear lots of hats, and do a little of everything. Sometimes the hat is a beanie, while other times it is like a Viking helmet, or has a bunch of fruit. As a sysadmin, I help make your stuff work better. 
 
Specialties: Systems administration, development environments, scripted automation, performance tuning, monitoring and alerting, disaster preparation and avoidance, ad-hoc telecommunications, improvised imaging systems, systems and network security, network printers and printing, webcam astrophotography, just-in-time duct tape applications, procedural documentation, wire untangling, Internet swashbuckling, lolcat divination, nuclear fusion reactors, email and spam-killing, kitchen biochemical warfare, and combustion-based musical instruments.
